meanings.definition: To shock or provoke by flaunting one's unconventional behavior or opinions.
meanings.sent1: She epaters her classmates by wearing mismatched socks to school.
meanings.sent2: The artist epaters the audience with his avant-garde paintings.
meanings.sent3: The comedian epaters the crowd by telling jokes in reverse order.
meanings.sent4: His bold fashion choices epaters even the most fashion-forward individuals.
meanings.sent5: The magician epaters the children with his disappearing act.

meanings.definition: A person who shocks or provokes by flaunting unconventional behavior or opinions.
meanings.sent1: The epaters at the party wore a top hat and flip-flops.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the epaters of the family for her eccentric ideas.
meanings.sent3: The epaters in the group always brings a llama to meetings for fun.
meanings.sent4: He stood out as the epaters in the crowd with his neon green hair.
meanings.sent5: The young artist was considered an epaters for her unique sculptures.
